vague_description: Determine the optimal combination of soda cans and glass bottles to meet production constraints and maximize output.
detailed_description: A soda company sells soda in two types of containers: cans and glass bottles. A can holds \param{CanVolume} ml of soda whereas a glass bottle holds \param{BottleVolume} ml of soda. The soda company needs to bottle at least \param{MinTotalVolume} ml of soda every day and due to the ability to sell soda cans as packs, there must be at least \param{CanBottleRatio} times more cans than glass bottles. However, because of previous contracts with gas stations, there must be at least \param{MinBottles} glass bottles made. How many of each should be made to maximize the total number of units produced?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of units (cans and bottles) produced
target_constraints: Number of glass bottles is non-negative
Total volume of soda from cans and bottles is at least MinTotalVolume ml
The number of cans is at least CanBottleRatio times greater than the number of glass bottles
At least MinBottles of glass bottles are produced
target_parameters: Volume of soda a can holds
Volume of soda a glass bottle holds
Minimum total volume of soda to bottle every day
Minimum ratio of the number of cans to the number of glass bottles
Minimum number of glass bottles to produce
